These things, and more, are what make each of us different. So how can we learn to embrace these differences, and celebrate them? Or to put it in a different way - how can we explore and welcome diversity?

title: English for Academic Study
summary: If you are preparing to study at a university where the first language is English, either on campus or online, this course aims to help you understand what is expected, and develop skills to help you learn independently and build your confidence.

Researchers at the University of Nottingham and University of Birmingham will show how these collections influence the way we view our world today.

title: Starting a Business 3: Customers and Competitors
summary: To run a successful business you need to understand who your customers are and more importantly, how you are going to reach them. Whether you have an idea for a future venture or you already have a side-line business whilst studying, this course will help you to recognise and understand your target market. It will give you the time to plan and help you to start documenting your thoughts in a structured business plan while allowing you to share your ideas with others.

title: Learning Online: Learning and Collaborating
summary: Online learning is likely to be important for you in the future, either at university or in the workplace. Learning online is different to learning in the classroom as it requires different skills. This course will help you to develop those skills, showing you how to learn and communicate effectively in an online environment.

title: Clinical Bioinformatics: Unlocking Genomics in Healthcare
summary: This free online course aims to raise awareness amongst healthcare professionals of the role of Clinical Bioinformatics and Genomics in healthcare today. We will illustrate how the discipline of Clinical Bioinformatics provides an important bridge between the cutting edge science and the delivery of genomic medicine in clinical practice. By understanding the role of a Clinical Bioinformatician it will become clear how integral they are to ensuring the beneficial opportunities of genomic medicine are fully realised in patient care.

title: Food as Medicine: Food and Inflammation
summary: On this course, designed specially for healthcare professionals, get an introduction to current evidence surrounding the impact of nutrition and foods on development and treatment of chronic low-grade inflammation, and potential subsequent disease development

title: Youth Mental Health: Helping Young People with Anxiety
summary: Anxiety is a common condition experienced by young people that can escalate to a point where it impacts on their general wellbeing and activities of daily living; brain development and performance at school or college. If untreated the risk of developing chronic and enduring mental health conditions increases, as well as the risks of deliberate self harm and suicide.

title: An Introduction to Radiation Oncology: From Diagnosis to Survivorship
summary: Radiation therapy is one of the key treatments for cancer. On this course you will learn from healthcare experts about how it works, the various benefits, and myths surrounding radiation therapy. You will also learn about the treatment pathway if youâ€™re prescribed a course of radiaton therapy.

title: Technology Entrepreneurship: How to Start a New Venture
summary: Being entrepreneurial is an exciting challenge and will help make your technology-based idea a reality.

title: Inclusive Learning and Teaching Environments
summary: According to research by the UK government, disabled people are around half as likely to hold a degree-level qualification than people without disabilities. It raises an important question: how can we make education more inclusive?

title: Get Started with Online Learning
summary: The internet is playing a bigger role in our lives, as we buy our groceries, manage our finances, share social experiences and otherwise live our lives online. But how many of us have considered studying online?

title: The Genomics Era: the Future of Genetics in Medicine
summary: This free online course will provide healthcare professionals with a basic grounding in genomic medicine. It will introduce you to new genomic technologies, which are revolutionising medicine and will, in time, provide the mainstay of patient diagnosis, treatment and disease prevention.

title: Innovation: the Fashion Industry
summary: This course introduces a case study showing how Marks & Spencer has been a key innovator in fashion, introducing new fabrics that make our lives easier and more comfortable.

title: Starting a Business 2: People and Networks
summary: A successful business relies heavily on people and networking. A good team and wider network are essential to success and growth. Whether you have an idea for a future venture or you already have a side-line business whilst studying, this course will help you to recognise the people who can help you take your business forward in both formal and informal business networks.

title: Starting a Business 4: Business Processes
summary: A successful business relies on processes and information systems; it is important that an entrepreneur pays close attention to how their business works and how performance can be improved so that they are in a position to take it forward and manage growth. Whether you have an idea for a future venture or you already have a side-line business whilst studying, this course cover efficient business processes to improve productivity.

title: Introduction to Norwegian
summary: Are you planning on going to Norway to study, travel or work? Are you interested in Norwegian culture? Are you looking for the key to the Scandinavian Model? Or a troll to marry?

title: World Class Maths: Asian Teaching Methods
summary: Get an introduction to Asian maths teaching methods for primary education, with this course from Macmillan Education and University of Southampton.

title: Exploring Our Oceans
summary: What lies in the half of our world covered by water more than two miles deep? How are our everyday lives connected to the ocean depths, and what challenges and opportunities does this previously hidden realm hold for our future?

title: Genomic Medicine: Transforming Patient Care in Diabetes
summary: There have been huge advances in the field of genetics in the last 10 years since the sequencing of the first human genome in 2003. It is now possible to analyse all 20,000 human genes in a single experiment, rather than focussing on one gene at a time. We are in the genomics era.

title: Whole Genome Sequencing: Decoding the Language of Life and Health
summary: Whole genome sequencing is a relatively new technology that allows us to â€˜readâ€™ a personâ€™s or organismâ€™s entire genetic code. But how does it work and what does it mean for all of us? How do scientists begin to make sense of the vast amount of information that whole genome sequencing provides? And what does this new technology mean for the future of healthcare and personalised medicine?

title: Introduction to Italian
summary: Have you been dreaming of visiting cities like Venice, Rome and Florence? Have you always wanted to learn Italian and get to know Italian culture? If so, this course is perfect for you.

title: Caring for People with Psychosis and Schizophrenia
summary: Psychosis conditions, including schizophrenia, are treatable mental health problems that can affect anyone although very few people talk about the conditions and their impact on families. Millions of people across the globe find themselves thrust unexpectedly into a role providing support and care when a relative develops psychosis. Carers can play a major role in supporting their relativeâ€™s progress and recovery.

title: Mergers and Acquisitions: Accounting Principles
summary: Once a company has merged or been acquired there are a number of key processes that can help ensure the deal is successful. On this course you will explore some of these processes and learn how to apply accounting and federal income tax principles to project earnings and cash flows, specifically of the post-combination entity.

title: Major Sport Events: Winning Through Diversity and Inclusion
summary: In this course youâ€™ll learn how athletes and para athletes prepare for a major sporting event.

title: Career Credentials: Evidence Your Expertise in Digital Literacy
summary: In an increasingly digitised world, digital literacy is now just as important as traditional literacy. So, itâ€™s no surprise that employer demand for skills in this area has surged.

title: Basic Science: Understanding Experiments
summary: On this practical course you will start thinking like a scientist, by carrying out experiments at home.

title: Environmental Justice
summary: The world faces challenging environmental problems. They are challenging because different people typically contribute differently to environmental change, and because its effects will be felt differently by different people in different places.

title: Smart Cities
summary: On this online course, youâ€™ll hear from smart city innovators, entrepreneurs, leaders, communities and businesses.

title: Filmmaking and Animation in the Classroom
summary: This free online course will help anyone working with young people aged 5-19 to engage them in learning through simple filmmaking and animation. Youâ€™ll discover how film and animation can be used as powerful tools for encouraging active learning and enabling pupils to establish strong connections with any area of the curriculum.

title: Quality Improvement in Healthcare: the Case for Change
summary: Why is quality improvement in health and social care systems so difficult? Why is it so challenging to bring in new and better ways of organising health and social care services?

title: Introduction to R for Data Science
summary: We live in a data driven world. So how can we make the most of it? Have you ever wondered how data-driven decisions are made?

title: Exploring Economics: Will the Next Generation Be Worse Off?
summary: The next generation faces uncertain economic prospects. This online course explains why.

title: German at Work Intermediate 1: Deutsch am Arbeitsplatz
summary: German is the most widely spoken native language in Europe, and German-speaking countries benefit from strong economics and low unemployment.

title: The Science Behind Forensic Science
summary: How does forensic science really work? How are scientific principles applied in crime scenes? Answer these questions and more with this course from the team who teach the longest-running forensic science programme of its type in England.

title: Military Ethics: an Introduction
summary: Military professionals are unusual in having the use of lethal force as a central, defining feature of their role, and unique in the level of force that they are authorized to use. This fact places a considerable ethical weight on military practitioners as well as the civilian decision-makers who authorize military missions.

title: Introduction to the UK Parliament: People, Processes and Public Participation
summary: This free online course will introduce you to the work and role of the UK Parliament. From setting the age at which we start school to deciding pension policy, the UK Parliament makes laws that impact our lives, our work and our wider society.

title: People Studying People: Research Ethics in Society
summary: If we consider data collection and its reporting to make up research, then we will all have been exposed to being participants in some form of social research. Data collection from people in society is now part of everyday life. Ethical research demands that respect is afforded to the rights and dignity of human participants. Studies need to be designed to be worthwhile and any potential harm anticipated and minimised. Ethical research requires thinking carefully about what constitutes participation in research and the responsibilities of researchers not only to participants, but also to all those affected by a study.

title: Global Health and Disability
summary: Around 15% of the worldâ€™s population, or 1 billion people, live with some form of disability, with numbers continuing to rise over the coming decades.

title: Understanding Diversity and Inclusion
summary: Many things contribute to an individualâ€™s identity, including race, ethnicity, gender, age, appearance, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, education, and political beliefs. These things, and more, are what make each of us different. So how can we learn to embrace these differences, and celebrate them? Or to put it in a different way - how can we explore and welcome diversity?

title: English for Academic Study
summary: If you are preparing to study at a university where the first language is English, either on campus or online, this course aims to help you understand what is expected, and develop skills to help you learn independently and build your confidence.

title: OPAT: Outpatient Parenteral Antimicrobial Therapy
summary: OPAT is a clinical service which enables patients with serious infection to be managed in an outpatient setting. The service aims to facilitate admission avoidance or early hospital discharge.

title: Integrating Care: Depression, Anxiety and Physical Illness
summary: Around 1 in 3 people have a long-term physical illness, and of these people around 1 in 3 also struggle with mental health problems like depression and anxiety. Symptoms like pain, fatigue, disability, and uncertainty around treatment, can all contribute to depression and anxiety, which in turn can worsen physical symptoms.

title: Cyber Security: Safety at Home, Online, in Life
summary: In the modern world, information security has an influence on all of us: at home, at work, online and in life in general. Like many inventions that have gone before, the internet and the web, the cloud and the Internet of Things (IoT) bring with them many advantages, but also open up new possibilities for criminal activity.

title: Managing Public Money
summary: The public sector provides a wide range of important services to citizens, including healthcare, education, transport, policing, justice and defence.

title: Effective Questioning for Call Handlers
summary: How an organisation handles phone calls can have a direct impact on its success - a badly handled call can mean limited information that might affect service delivery, customer satisfaction and even safety.

title: Dementia and the Arts: Sharing Practice, Developing Understanding and Enhancing Lives
summary: Creating a society that supports and includes those of us who are living with a dementia is a major challenge - and opportunity. In this course you will discover how the arts can create a common ground between people, and in doing so, learn what we can all do to improve the quality of life and care for people living with different dementias.

title: Human Factors in a Healthcare Environment
summary: Human factors is the study of how humans behave and interact with each other and their surroundings. It considers how humans interact in the workplace and how, due to the inevitability of human error, mistakes are likely to occur.

title: Teaching Students Who Have Suffered Complex Trauma
summary: Complex trauma affects the physical, emotional and social development of children and adolescents.

title: Modern Building Design
summary: Climate change, technology and regulation are changing modern building design, and the professional practices of the architecture, engineering and construction (AEC) industry.

title: Medicines Adherence: Understanding and Changing Patient Behaviour
summary: This course has been designed by psychologists and clinicians at Kingâ€™s College London for people interested in medicines adherence.

title: Talking About Cancer: Reducing Risk, Early Detection and Mythbusting
summary: Talking about cancer can be tough. You might be worried that youâ€™ll say the wrong thing or that you simply donâ€™t know enough about the subject.

title: Irish 101: An Introduction to Irish Language and Culture
summary: Ireland is home to a unique language and a vibrant Gaelic culture.

title: Teaching Entrepreneurial Thinking
summary: We live in an uncertain and complex world, where the big problems of today and tomorrow are yet to be identified.

title: German at Work Post-Beginners 1: Deutsch am Arbeitsplatz
summary: Language skills are vital in our interconnected economies. People who use their knowledge of other languages and cultures in the workplace can open up professional opportunities.

title: Bacterial Genomes: Accessing and Analysing Microbial Genome Data
summary: Applying increasingly powerful computation to genomics contributes to important medical breakthroughs.

title: Irish 105: An Introduction to Irish Language and Culture
summary: Endorsed and supported by the Irish government, this course is the perfect opportunity for you to continue developing your understanding of Irish language and culture.

title: Understanding Financial Statements
summary: Every business maintains financial records that help us to understand how well itâ€™s doing. In this course, youâ€™ll learn how to read them.

title: Making Music with Others
summary: This online course will help you reflect on your own music-making activities and the way you interact with other musicians.

title: Enhancing the Quality of Urban Life: Fifteen Winning Projects of the Aga Khan Award for Architecture
summary: This open online course looks at the challenges of enhancing the quality of urban life as they have been addressed by projects from across the world that have received the Aga Khan Award for Architecture. All of these projects have benefited Muslim communities, but the messages they communicate are universal.

title: An Introduction to Organisational Behaviour: How to Understand Your People
summary: Understanding how a business behaves can help us to understand how a business works - and how it can be made to work better. We call this discipline â€˜organisational behaviourâ€™.

title: An Introduction to Physical Health Assessment
summary: The â€˜head-to-toeâ€™ assessment is considered one of the best ways to quickly determine a patientâ€™s overall condition. As such, itâ€™s an invaluable nursing skill. You will explore assessment methods on this course. You will be introduced to different patients and follow them through their health journey, considering the conditions they may be suffering from.

title: How We Remember War and Violence: Theory and Practice
summary: Our memories of conflict are often used against us. Nationalist movements manipulate the story - offering confrontational, harmful perspectives. But thereâ€™s a different way.

title: Could You Be the Next Florence Nightingale?
summary: Some consider Florence Nightingale the founder of modern nursing. Within the scientific community she is credited for initiating nursing training and education programmes, but rarely acknowledged as a social reformer and public health campaigner.

title: Understanding and Teaching Evolution
summary: Why do lions have long manes but not lionesses? Why do men have beards? Is evolution a fact or a theory?

title: Social and Digital Media Analytics
summary: How can social and digital media help a business improve? How can we get useful data from social and digital media? What are the limitations of such data?

title: Developing Your Research Project
summary: Curiosity is one of humanityâ€™s most important characteristics. It has enabled us to make the unknown known, to break barriers and to shine a light on all aspects of life, from our day to day hobbies to the exploration of the stars. Our innate desire to explore is responsible for many of our proudest achievements. This course will help train you to harness your curiosity and use it to undertake your own research projects in a scholarly manner.

title: The Science of Nuclear Energy
summary: With the need to reduce carbon emissions around the world, the way we generate our power has to change and nuclear energy is back on the political agenda.

title: Business Fundamentals: Customer Engagement
summary: When did you last do business with someone you didnâ€™t trust? Or who broke a promise? Building a relationship with your customer involves time, communication and commitment, but the benefits are a sure way to help your business succeed and grow.

title: Spanish for Beginners 1: Meeting and Greeting
summary: This free online course is the first of six in the Spanish for Beginners program. It will introduce you to the basic language, so that you are able to:

title: Using Infection Control to Combat Antimicrobial Resistance
summary: This online course will explore the growing problem of antimicrobial-resistant infections in health and social care settings.

title: Clinical Supervision: Planning Your Professional Development
summary: This online course will focus on identifying your learning needs as a clinical supervisor or practice educator, and provide advice on creating a personal development plan to address them.

title: Digital Skills: User Experience
summary: User experience, known as UX, makes a huge difference to whether a digital product, or project, succeeds. On this course, you will learn what UX is and why itâ€™s so important. Youâ€™ll learn the foundations of UX design and what distinguishes good from bad UX. You will also explore the UX design process; user research, designing your experience, using your goals and ideas to draw wireframes and then building usable prototypes.

title: Antisemitism: From Its Origins to the Present
summary: In this course, 50 leading scholars from all over the world will explore questions and issues relating to antisemitism including: what is antisemitism? How has it changed throughout history? Why can it be found among so many diverse cultures, and even among opposing ideologies? What happened to antisemitism after the Holocaust? How is antisemitism expressed today, and what are the main spheres in which it can be found?

title: The Science of Learning
summary: What is learning? How does it work? On this course you try and answer these questions, exploring how you can use the science of learning to inform your teaching and support your studentsâ€™ learning.

title: The Digital Economy: Finance for Business Growth
summary: Every business needs cash to grow and develop. Some can find enough cash from their operations. Others might need external sources of finance, like a bank loan. So how does a business make robust decisions about borrowing?

title: Finance Fundamentals: Investment Theory and Practice
summary: Research shows that UK households are poor at investment management, with a limited understanding of choices, risks and returns. This could mean that many people cannot afford to retire in future.

title: Functional Programming in Haskell: Supercharge Your Coding
summary: Do you want to develop software using the latest programming language paradigm? Haskell is a functional programming language, based on formal mathematical principles. As such, it is easy to reason about and develop, and it executes efficiently on modern multicore machines. From investment banks to social networks, everyone is adopting Haskell.

title: Exploring Copyright: History, Culture, Industry
summary: Have you ever thought about how a composer or a writer makes a living? This course will explore the history of creators becoming professionals. Youâ€™ll learn how copyright law developed from the idea that an artistic work is the property of its creator. Youâ€™ll discover how advances in communication, beginning with the invention of the printing press in the 15th century, have enabled the growth of the creative industries. Weâ€™ll also consider why the latest digital technologies present both opportunities and challenges for todayâ€™s copyright holders.

title: How to Succeed in Your EPQ: the Nuts and Bolts of Completing Your Project
summary: Thinking about doing an EPQ? Or already undertaking an EPQ and feeling overwhelmed? Or just want to get some tips?

title: Digital Skills: Retail
summary: Digital technology is transforming the world of retail. Youâ€™ll learn about the impact of this transformation, from data transforming customer experiences and operations, to the increasing impact of connected devices and automation.

title: Sustainable Construction and Development
summary: Sustainable development meets the needs of the present by carrying out activities that do not compromise future generationsâ€™ ability to meet their own needs.

title: Irish Lives in War and Revolution: Exploring Ireland's History 1912-1923
summary: How do people experience war and revolution? How does political change, violence, total war, affect life in its most basic ways? Looking at Ireland through war and revolution, this course considers these and other questions about Irish life between 1912 and 1923.

title: Discovering Your PhD Potential: Writing a Research Proposal
summary: A carefully prepared and thorough research proposal is usually crucial for applications for advanced or doctoral study, and can provide the launchpad for the first stages of that postgraduate study.

title: Game Design and Development: A Bit-by-Bit History of Video Game Music
summary: This online course introduces you to video game music and the platforms that define it, focusing on the evolution of the classic 8-bit sound.

title: Blended Learning Essentials: Developing Digital Skills
summary: Almost every job now involves a range of digital skills, yet employers report a shortage in skilled new starters. This course will enable you, as a teacher or trainer to develop your learnersâ€™ digital skills for successful employment and progress in the modern workplace. Through real-life case studies, resources and practical support youâ€™ll be able to help your learners manage their online identity and digital information required for their work. Weâ€™ll show you how to assist learners to create digital content and provide you with tools for communicating effectively and working collaboratively.

title: Food as Medicine: Food and our Genome
summary: How does our genome affect our health? Should patients adjust their diets according to their genes? Answer these questions and more with this course designed to give healthcare professionals the latest information on food and genetics.

title: The Lancet Maternal Health Series: Global Research and Evidence
summary: Imagine a woman in a remote village, perhaps in Africa or South Asia. Sheâ€™s giving birth at home with a relative. Without access to drugs or transport, she could die. While maternal deaths have nearly halved in the past 25 years worldwide, thanks to the increased use of maternity services, progress has not been universal.

title: Corpus Linguistics: Method, Analysis, Interpretation
summary: This course offers a practical introduction to corpus linguistics, an extremely versatile methodology of language analysis using computers. Over eight weeks, course participants will be equipped with skills necessary for collecting and analysing large digital collections of text (corpora) and introduced to a number of topics demonstrating the use of corpora in areas as diverse as discourse analysis, sociolinguistics, and language learning and teaching.

title: Big Data: Mathematical Modelling
summary: Mathematics is everywhere, and with the rise of big data it becomes a useful tool when extracting information and analysing large datasets. We begin by explaining how maths underpins many of the tools that are used to manage and analyse big data. We show how very different applied problems can have common mathematical aims, and therefore can be addressed using similar mathematical tools. We then introduce three such tools, based on a linear algebra framework: eigenvalues and eigenvectors for ranking; graph Laplacian for clustering; and singular value decomposition for data compression.

title: Why Do People Migrate? Facts
summary: Migration often makes headlines; itâ€™s become a key issue of politicians worldwide. But what is the reality of migration? This course will introduce you to key challenges of irregular migration and asylum seeking worldwide. Youâ€™ll look at key cases from around the globe, including asylum seekers arriving in Europe via the Mediterranean and Syrian refugees in Turkey, Central American labour migration to the USA and the Rohingya refugee challenge in Southeast Asia.

title: Positive Parenting After Separation

title: Introduction to Psychology: Sensation and Perception
summary: How do our sensory systems work together to help us understand the world and somebody elseâ€™s behaviour?

title: Data Science for Healthcare: Using Real World Evidence
summary: Real world data (RWD) is the huge quantity of data that falls outside the boundaries of controlled clinical trials, data that is increasingly used to inform decisions in healthcare. Real world evidence (RWE), is the conclusions drawn from this data.

title: Supporting Adolescent Learners: Social and Emotional Wellbeing
summary: A large and growing body of research shows that adolescents who score high on social and emotional wellbeing report improved grades, better relationships, less trouble at school and a lesser likelihood of emotional problems.

summary: Too many patients die or suffer prolonged complications following surgery.

title: Modern Empowerment in the Workplace

title: Healthcare Research: For Healthcare Professionals
summary: Research is a vital part of healthcare. It underpins best practice, provides evidence for national and international guidelines, and ultimately improves outcomes for patients. This online course provides an introduction to healthcare research.

title: Clinical Supervision for Health Professionals
summary: What does it take to become an effective clinical supervisor? This course introduces you to the skills and tools you need to approach your supervisory responsibilities with more confidence. Youâ€™ll explore the core principles of learning and teaching in a clinical setting, and understand how to create optimal learning environments. Youâ€™ll find out how to compose constructive feedback and communicate it to students effectively. Youâ€™ll learn how to apply key strategies to your own practice, so your students experience a productive and successful clinical placement.

title: Business Model Thinking
summary: Do you have a business idea? Can your idea make a difference?

summary: The issue of medical diagnosis in mental health has always been contentious, with many professionals questioning the reliability and validity of psychiatric diagnosis.

title: Emotional Intelligence at Work
summary: On this course you will explore how emotional intelligence influences not only our relationships with others but also with ourselves.

title: Basics of Network Security
summary: On this course you will examine the theory and practice of network fundamentals from the defenderâ€™s and attackerâ€™s perspectives. You will have the opportunity to use tools for networking that allow you to query services, test routing and more. At the end of the course, you will have the opportunity to challenge yourself to a network security boot camp â€“ can you work with a virtual networked device to make it secure?

title: The Importance of Project Management in the Global Construction Industry
summary: This course is designed to provide you with a broad overview of the make-up of a project and the fundamental activities that take place in construction project management.

title: Social Wellbeing
summary: Since the financial crisis, there has been an increased interest in moving away from GDP and wealth as measures of national and individual performance. Instead, more explicit attention is being paid to wellbeing around the world, and how we can promote it at individual, local, national and international levels.

title: Social Business: a Sustainable Way to Face the Most Pressing Needs of Our Time
summary: This free online course focuses on the concept of Social Business and the main variables that we need to take into account when creating a Social Business.

title: The Future of Farming: Exploring Climate Smart Agriculture
summary: Global warming is a reality so itâ€™s vital our societies and industries respond to the changing climate. Can farming meet this challenge?

title: Supercomputing
summary: Todayâ€™s supercomputers are the most powerful calculating machines ever invented, capable of performing more than a thousand million million calculations every second. This gives scientists and engineers a powerful new tool to study the natural world â€“ computer simulation.

title: More Data Mining with Weka
summary: This course introduces advanced data mining skills, following on from Data Mining with Weka. Youâ€™ll process a dataset with 10 million instances. Youâ€™ll mine a 250,000-word text dataset. Youâ€™ll analyze a supermarket dataset representing 5000 shopping baskets. Youâ€™ll learn about filters for preprocessing data, selecting attributes, classification, clustering, association rules, cost-sensitive evaluation. Youâ€™ll meet learning curves and automatically optimize learning parameters. Weka originated at the University of Waikato in NZ, and Ian Witten has authored a leading book on data mining.

title: The Role of Personal Assistants in Disability Support
summary: Disabled people can now receive funding from their local authority to employ a personal assistant. While this gives them more personalised care in their own home, it also turns them into an employer.

title: Understanding Energy Storage: The Battery Revolution
summary: With more energy coming from renewable sources and a rising demand for stable energy supply, the world needs flexible energy storage. Batteries might be the answer.

title: Introduction to Building Information Modelling
summary: Building Information Modelling (BIM) is a process that encourages collaborative working. Why is it important? Why is the industry looking towards BIM and what historical issues does it aim to relieve? This course will help you develop a better understanding of BIM, the role it plays within the industry, and act as a gateway to further study in Construction Management and BIM.

title: An Introduction to the Assessment of People at Work
summary: Why do we assess people at work? How do we do it?

title: Cultural Diplomacy
summary: What does cultural diplomacy mean? How does it work in practice? What effect does it have in todayâ€™s world? Get the answers with this introduction to cultural diplomacy.

title: Improving Your Image: Dental Photography in Practice
summary: This course will cover all aspects of the use of digital photography in dental practice: intra-oral, extra-oral, and portraits. You will be taken from the basics of choosing correct equipment and setting it up, to optimum settings, techniques for consistent imaging and the safe storage of images.

title: Crime, Justice and Society
summary: What should the role of the police be? How do victims experience criminal justice? Are there alternative responses to crime instead of prosecution and conviction?

summary: Nurses play an important role in providing healthcare around the world and, in some countries, form more than 50% of the healthcare workforce. summary: With effective behaviour management in your classroom, your learners will gain as a result and youâ€™ll enjoy your teaching more.

title: Creating Apps in the Classroom
summary: There are many educational apps available, but the majority are created by non-educators.

summary: This course offers a practical introduction to corpus linguistics, an extremely versatile methodology of language analysis using computers. title: Big Data: Mathematical Modelling
summary: Mathematics is everywhere, and with the rise of big data it becomes a useful tool when extracting information and analysing large datasets. We begin by explaining how maths underpins many of the tools that are used to manage and analyse big data. We show how very different applied problems can have common mathematical aims, and therefore can be addressed using similar mathematical tools. We then introduce three such tools, based on a linear algebra framework: eigenvalues and eigenvectors for ranking; graph Laplacian for clustering; and singular value decomposition for data compression.

title: Italian for Beginners 1: Meeting, Greeting and Eating
summary: This free online course is the first of six in the Italian for Beginners program. It will introduce you to the basic language, so that you are able to:

summary: What happens when water runs out, and why does it occur? How can we ensure an adequate fresh water supply for all?

title: Clinical Supervision for Health Professionals
summary: What does it take to become an effective clinical supervisor? This course introduces you to the skills and tools you need to approach your supervisory responsibilities with more confidence. summary: The issue of medical diagnosis in mental health has always been contentious, with many professionals questioning the reliability and validity of psychiatric diagnosis.

summary: On this course you will explore how emotional intelligence influences not only our relationships with others but also with ourselves.

title: Basics of Network Security
summary: On this course you will examine the theory and practice of network fundamentals from the defenderâ€™s and attackerâ€™s perspectives. You will have the opportunity to use tools for networking that allow you to query services, test routing and more. At the end of the course, you will have the opportunity to challenge yourself to a network security boot camp â€“ can you work with a virtual networked device to make it secure?

summary: This course is designed to provide you with a broad overview of the make-up of a project and the fundamental activities that take place in construction project management.

Instead, more explicit attention is being paid to wellbeing around the world, and how we can promote it at individual, local, national and international levels.

summary: This free online course focuses on the concept of Social Business and the main variables that we need to take into account when creating a Social Business.

title: The Future of Farming: Exploring Climate Smart Agriculture
summary: Global warming is a reality so itâ€™s vital our societies and industries respond to the changing climate. Can farming meet this challenge?

summary: Todayâ€™s supercomputers are the most powerful calculating machines ever invented, capable of performing more than a thousand million million calculations every second. This gives scientists and engineers a powerful new tool to study the natural world â€“ computer simulation.

title: More Data Mining with Weka
summary: This course introduces advanced data mining skills, following on from Data Mining with Weka. Youâ€™ll process a dataset with 10 million instances. Youâ€™ll mine a 250,000-word text dataset. Youâ€™ll analyze a supermarket dataset representing 5000 shopping baskets. Youâ€™ll learn about filters for preprocessing data, selecting attributes, classification, clustering, association rules, cost-sensitive evaluation. Youâ€™ll meet learning curves and automatically optimize learning parameters. Weka originated at the University of Waikato in NZ, and Ian Witten has authored a leading book on data mining.

summary: When preparing a community for an incident, creating plans for identified risks and implementing mitigation measures is key.

summary: Butoh dance is practiced and researched globally, but the work of its founder, Hijikata Tatsumi, is relatively unknown. This is in part because archival materials necessary to learning about Hijikataâ€™s butoh are not widely disseminated.

summary: In a globalised world, workplaces are increasingly filled with a mix of people from a wide variety of places, with a mix of cultures. Good cultural intelligence (CQ) - the ability to work effectively across cultures - is vital.

summary: Microbes may be invisible to the eye, but they dominate every environment on Earth â€“ including you. Microbes are often associated with disease yet the majority of species help to keep us alive. How can you distinguish the good from the bad?

summary: Engineering mechanics is the science-based analysis that engineers use to predict how their designs will perform. It is vital to ensure engineers can meet their responsibilities for performance and safety.

summary: The number of adults with diabetes is predicted to increase by more than 50% to 642 million by 2040. title: Development and Planning in African Cities: Exploring theories, policies and practices from Sierra Leone
summary: In the next 35 years, Africa will need to accommodate almost 900 million new urban dwellers. Hundreds of smaller cities are doubling in size every 20 years, half of Africaâ€™s urban dwellers live in informal settlements in precarious conditions, and 75% of these are younger than 35.

title: Make Change Happen
summary: If we want to make effective and lasting social change, we must understand power dynamics, social systems and how change really happens.

title: Global Biosecurity for One Health

summary: Environmental and climate change impact our lives, but how what role does data play in informing us about such changes to our world? On this online course, we examine and explore the use of statistics and data science in better understanding the environment we live in.

summary: The physical examination of a baby in the first hours of life is an essential part of newborn care and an important event for parents.

summary: University research has always made a difference to human understanding. Sadly, the importance of this work isnâ€™t always communicated to the world outside of academia - leading many academics to believe that research is undervalued in society.

summary: This course takes an innovative approach to exploring history, focusing on Lancaster Castle as a microcosm of broader trends. This fascinating location provides a wealth of evidence from the remains of Roman forts to its life as a prison and visitor attraction.

title: The Power of Podcasting for Storytelling
summary: Podcasting has become an increasingly popular way to tell stories, the number of podcasts grows each year. There are now over half a million podcasts according to Apple.

title: Migrants and Refugees in Education: A toolkit for teachers
summary: The British Councilâ€™s Language for Resilience programme highlights opportunities for teachers and learners to foster resilience in language classrooms across the world.

title: Music Psychology: Why Does "Bohemian Rhapsody" Feel so Good?
summary: Some songs make us laugh and some songs make us cry, but why does music have the ability to affect us emotionally?

title: Social Change: How Can Marketing Help?
summary: Marketing is often used to influence consumer behaviour, but it can also be used to promote social good.

title: Planning for Learning in STEM Teaching: Formative Assessment for Tailored Learning
summary: Guided by experts in assessment for learning, on this course youâ€™ll discover how to gauge your learnersâ€™ understanding - and then effectively progress their understanding.

title: Through Engineers' Eyes: Expanding the Vision: Engineering Mechanics by Experiment, Analysis and Design
summary: In this course, you will learn analytical skills, use them to understand experiments and apply them in design. You will be living in the engineerâ€™s world.

title: European Culture and Politics
summary: We revisit perceived truths about the meaning of European identity. We examine how cultural knowledge and facts were constructed to further post-World War II integration. We will help you understand and identify the complexities of the contemporary crises of European integration and support you in developing novel responses to these crises.

title: Causes of Climate Change
summary: This free online course provides the basis for understanding the underlying physical processes governing climate variations in the past, present and future.

title: Making Babies in the 21st Century
summary: This course looks at six different areas of assisted reproduction and explores both the science and the impact they are having. The course is structured as a journey, taking as its starting point a person or couple who might make use of technology in order to conceive. The course also looks at the powerful new genetic techniques that are creating new opportunities in the field of reproduction.

title: Understanding Quantum Computers
summary: In this course, we will discuss the motivation for building quantum computers, cover the important principles in quantum computing, and take a look at some of the important quantum computing algorithms.

title: Cancer Survivorship for Primary Care Practitioners
summary: Cancer is a major burden of disease across the globe. Every year, millions of people are diagnosed with the illness.

title: Introduction to Forensic Science
summary: The course addresses four major evidence types: drugs of abuse, DNA, firearms and impression evidence, and discusses these through the exploration of a case-based scenario presented across a six-week modular framework.

title: Exploring Play: the Importance of Play in Everyday Life
summary: This course from the School of Education at the University of Sheffield will encourage you to think differently about play.

title: Eliminating Trachoma
summary: An estimated 200 million people are at risk of trachoma in 42 countries. Trachoma is a neglected tropical disease. It occurs in some of the poorest populations with limited access to clean water, sanitation, and healthcare, and is the worldâ€™s leading infectious cause of blindness. At present, we have a unique opportunity to eliminate this disease.

title: Islamic Calligraphy: an Introduction to the Art of Handwriting
summary: Islamic calligraphy has long been admired for its beautiful form and line work. As an art form it actually includes various other types of calligraphy including Arabic, Persian and Ottoman.

title: Causes of Human Disease: Understanding Causes of Disease
summary: What causes human disease? Why do some people get a disease but others donâ€™t? Through this course, youâ€™ll learn how epidemiologists are helping to find answers to these complex questions and how the health of a population is measured and analysed. By looking at stimulating case studies, youâ€™ll explore how the social determinants of health contribute to human disease and how health inequalities exist. You will then look at health inequalities across the globe and investigate how and why different socioeconomic factors determine human health.

title: World Class Maths: Asian Teaching Practice
summary: Get an introduction to Asian maths teaching methods for primary education, with this course from Macmillan Education and University of Southampton.

title: Biochemistry: the Molecules of Life
summary: Biochemistry brings together all of the sciences to study the chemical and physical processes that occur in living organisms. It truly is the science of life.

title: Come Rain or Shine: Understanding the Weather
summary: Weather affects our lives almost every day through what we wear, what we eat and what we do. But why is it rainy, windy or sometimes even sunny? Explore some of the physical processes driving UK weather systems and get hands on in the world of weather with practical activities and fieldwork. Try your hand at forecasting and have a go at interpreting weather maps and compare your results to our educator Dr Sylvia Knightâ€™s. Youâ€™ll also watch our educators carrying out simple but effective experiments including creating clouds or simulating hot air rising and demonstrating the Coriolis effect.

title: Brain and Behavior: Regulating Body Weight
summary: Many complex factors are involved in the regulation of body weight and control of food intake. This course explores how body weight is influenced by external and internal stimuli, and how these stimuli interact or influence one another. By the end of the course you will be able to discuss the meaning of energy homeostasis, describe the physiological factors that influence hunger and fullness, explain how environmental stimuli influence eating, and summarize how our genes interact with the environment to influence body weight.

title: Introduction to Malay Language
summary: Over 60 million people speak Malay; it is an official language of several countries including Singapore and Malaysia. On this course youâ€™ll get an introduction to the basics of Malay and discover more about Malaysia as a place and culture. This means learning to speak simple Malay and learning about writing in Malay, practicing both until you can identity common words and phrases used by native speakers. Plus you will explore fascinating Malay culture learning more about the many interesting places in Malaysia.

title: Effective Fundraising and Leadership in Arts and Culture

On this course you will learn about the importance of developing organisational resilience through effective leadership and management, and how to diversify income streams by becoming more entrepreneurial. You will explore different leadership styles, change management and entrepreneurship, so youâ€™ll be in a better position to lead your organisationâ€™s fundraising strategy and offer better value to your audiences.

title: Environmental Challenges: Justice in Natural Resource Management
summary: When looking at different societies and cultures around the world, it is interesting how ubiquitous the principles of justice are. It is part of our human nature to think about equality, and consider fairness as something that we do naturally. However, in practical terms, equality is hard to achieve.

title: Studying in Italian - Science and Mathematics: a MOVE-ME Project Course
summary: Each year thousands of students travel across Europe to study in a foreign language like Italian. This can be daunting, even for those who are fluent.

title: Creating Moments of Joy for People with Alzheimerâ€™s
summary: When someone has short-term memory loss their life is made up of moments. This means we cannot always create a wonderful day, but we can create a wonderful moment.

title: Management and Leadership: Planning Your Personal Development
summary: Personal development is an essential management skill. This online course will help you define your development needs and recognise opportunities for development.

title: Communicating Effectively with Vulnerable Children and Young People

title: Getting Care Right for All Children: Implementing the UN Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children
summary: Taking the UN Guidelines as a framework, this free online course will help you gain insight into how the unnecessary placement of a child in alternative care can be prevented; how alternative care can constitute a suitable, positive experience for a child when it is necessary; and how children and young people who are leaving care can best be supported. Learn with alternative care specialists from CELCIS, UNICEF and the UN.

title: Management and Leadership: Growing as a Manager
summary: This online course will provide an introduction to the foundation skills and knowledge you need when becoming a manager.

title: Studying in Italian - Language and Literature: a MOVE-ME Project Course
summary: Each year thousands of students travel across Europe to study in a foreign language like Italian. This can be daunting, even for those who are fluent.

title: Technical Report Writing for Engineers
summary: Technical reports are a vital tool for engineers to communicate their ideas. This online course introduces technical report writing and teaches the techniques you need to construct well-written engineering reports.

title: Studying in Italian - Law and Economics: a MOVE-ME Project Course
summary: Each year thousands of students travel across Europe to study in a foreign language like Italian. This can be daunting, even for those who are fluent.

title: Writing Better Emails
summary: Email writing is one of the universally important skills in todayâ€™s workplace. But it is rarely taught in higher education institutions and many young people arrive in the workplace having never written a professional email. Equally, people with many yearsâ€™ work experience have never been taught email writing skills.

title: Language Testing During Awake Brain Surgery
summary: Language representation in the brain can be studied by testing language during awake brain surgery. In this course, you will get to know the importance of neurolinguistics and awake brain surgery by seeing the collaboration between surgical staff and neurolinguists before, during and after the operation.
